para.text: A court of the District may grant any relief normally available under the law of the District to enforce a registered child-custody determination made by a court of another state.
A court of the District shall recognize and enforce, but may not modify, except in accordance with subchapter II of this chapter, a registered child-custody determination of a court of another state.

annotations.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 306 of the Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (1997 Act).
